topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5537219763687204da6f0500#post_5537219763687204da6f0500
And the whole point of "courage" was that it WASN'T some special power. It was ordinary. Not special. That means everyone can have it. Asura thought the only escape from fear was insanity. So much so that he BECAME an embodiment if insanity. When Maka pushed throug her fear to fight Asura on her own she was showing him another way to beat fear. One that didn't rely on insanity. She negated the existance of a Lovecraftian horror. By punching it.

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5537228a6368727caa0d1a00#post_5537228a6368727caa0d1a00
I'll point out why Deus Ex Machina are terrible:
Let's say hypothetically every villain in MLP:FIM was instead defeated by the elements of harmony: would you agree that would be terrible endings instead?  Instead bug lady was defeated by elements of harmony, flim flam defeated by the elements of harmony, instead emo oc shadow pony was defeated by the elements of harmony, instead social justice pony was defeated by the elements of harmony and so forth.  Would you enjoy watching that?

Remember how much people hated Matrix Revolutions?

Deus Ex Machina are the poor mans' conflict resolution.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553724996368721f26c10700#post_553724996368721f26c10700
Okay reasons why the ending to the Soul Eater anime sucks:
1)It's never explained how she defeated him fully or where that power came from. . . and no I don't mean a bullshit cheesy speech.
2)The power to defeat him came out of fucking nowhere.
3)She got her ass kicked and all of a sudden *poof* magical plot resolution powers.
4)There was no conflict resolution at all, just *poof* magical plot resolution powers and the end.
5)Almost everyone that has watched soul eater agrees that the ending was bad because it was a deus ex machina.
6)The ending made no sense at all cause from a story standpoint it was *poof* you now have magical abilities that have never been brought up before, will never be spoken about again and is never brought up by any of the other characters.

The ending plot wise made about as much sense as:
!http://www.ultraimg.com/images/c0d.gif!

No offense, but this is why I just outright ignore any anime you suggest cause I've noticed a trend where the main character just goes *poof* magical ability that has never been referenced before that point and will never be referenced again by any of the other characters to defeat enemies and the protagonist actually defeating the villain takes all of two seconds.


Reason why I don't watch any anime you suggest in a nutshell:
Villain, "haha you can't defeat me!"
Hero, "I'm getting my ass kicked! . . Wait I know!"
*Hero uses the power of heart*
*IT'S SUPER EFFECTIVE!*
Villain, "curses I've been foiled!"

Using the THE POWER OF HEART to defeat enemies is beyond cliche and is beyond boring.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
